input: word: keep [SEP] sentence 1: May God keep you. [SEP] sentence 2: She keeps an apartment in Paris for her shopping trips.
word: keep [SEP] sentence 1: Keep food for a week in the pantry. [SEP] sentence 2: She keeps a sixpack and a week's worth of supplies in the refrigerator.
word: pay [SEP] sentence 1: It will pay to wait. [SEP] sentence 2: He paid me 5000 pounds for the car.
word: hold [SEP] sentence 1: Hold one's nose. [SEP] sentence 2: I hold with those who say life is sacred.
word: coverage [SEP] sentence 1: The enemy fire is increasing -- can we get some immediate coverage from those bunkers? [SEP] sentence 2: There are overlapping coverages on your insurance policies.
word: defense [SEP] sentence 1: In defense he said the other man started it. [SEP] sentence 2: The artillery battered down the defenses.
word: approach [SEP] sentence 1: To approach the city. [SEP] sentence 2: He was an admirable poet, and thought even to have approached Homer. -- Sir William Temple.
word: catch [SEP] sentence 1: Catch the mood. [SEP] sentence 2: The Rolls Royce caught us near the exit ramp.
